universum.studios.android.transition

Class NavigationalTransition

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.transition.BaseNavigationalTransition<NavigationalTransition>
      • universum.studios.android.transition.NavigationalTransition

  • public class NavigationalTransition
extends BaseNavigationalTransition<NavigationalTransition>
    A BaseNavigationalTransition implementation that may be used also from a context of framework's Fragment.

    See start(Fragment) and finish(Fragment) for more information.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class universum.studios.android.transition.BaseNavigationalTransition

        MATERIAL_SUPPORT, mClassOfTransitionActivity, RC_NONE

      Creates a new instance of NavigationalTransition with the specified classOfTransitionActivity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NavigationalTransition

        public NavigationalTransition()
        Creates a new instance of NavigationalTransition without transition activity.

      • NavigationalTransition

        public NavigationalTransition(@NonNull
                              Class<? extends Activity> classOfTransitionActivity)
        Creates a new instance of NavigationalTransition with the specified classOfTransitionActivity.
        Parameters:
        classOfTransitionActivity - The activity class that will be used to create an Intent whenever starting this transition.
        See Also:
        BaseNavigationalTransition.createIntent(Activity)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(@NonNull
                  Fragment caller)
        Starts this navigational transition using the given caller fragment with transitions and shared elements that are configured for the caller's parent activity via BaseNavigationalTransition.configureOutgoingTransitions(Activity).

        Note that unlike BaseNavigationalTransition.start(Activity) this cannot be used to start new activity with shared elements presented. For that purpose use BaseNavigationalTransition.start(Activity) instead.

        Parameters:
        caller - The fragment that will be used to create and start an Intent created via BaseNavigationalTransition.createIntent(Activity).
        See Also:
        BaseNavigationalTransition.configureTransitions(Activity)

      • onStart

        protected void onStart(@NonNull
                       Fragment caller)
        Invoked whenever start(Fragment) is called.

        Default implementation starts an Intent created via BaseNavigationalTransition.createIntent(Activity) using the given caller fragment via Fragment.startActivity(Intent) if there was no BaseNavigationalTransition.requestCode() specified and via Fragment.startActivityForResult(Intent, int) if there was.

        Parameters:
        caller - The caller fragment that requested start of this navigational transition.
        See Also:
        onFinish(Fragment)

      • finish

        public void finish(@NonNull
                   Fragment caller)
        Finishes host activity of the given caller fragment in order to run its exit transitions.
        Parameters:
        caller - The fragment of which activity should be finished and of which exit transitions should be started.
        See Also:
        start(Fragment)

      • onFinish

        protected void onFinish(@NonNull
                        Fragment caller)
        Invoked whenever finish(Fragment) is called.

        Default implementation invokes BaseNavigationalTransition.onFinish(Activity) with a host activity of the given caller fragment.

        Parameters:
        caller - The fragment that requested finish of its host activity via this navigational transition.
        See Also:
        onStart(Fragment)
